com.unibeta.vrules.servlets

Class VRules4jServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.unibeta.vrules.servlets.VRules4jServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.servlet.Servlet

    public class VRules4jServlet
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.servlet.Servlet
    VRulesEngineServlet is a servelt used to plug vRuels4j into the container as a standalone component. If vRules is deployed to Web Container (such as Tomcat, Websphere, or Weblogic), configure below context into web.xml to enable vRules4j engine for JaveEE.

    For Example: 
       <servlet>
         <servlet-name>vRules4jServlet</servlet-name>
         <servlet-class>
             com.unibeta.vrules.servlets.VRules4jServlet
         </servlet-class>
         <load-on-startup>1</load-on-startup>
   </servlet>
    Notes: It was optional from v3.1.x version. User do not have to do servlet configuration in v3.1 above, the engine will detect the classpath in runtime.
    For IBM WebSphere container, it is mandatory.
    Author:
    Jordan.Xue
